resources.string: Hide My Applist has filtered total %d requests

Establish templates for "restless" apps, controlling applist they can obtain.

Blacklist (recommended): the apps selected in the template will be invisible to the apps applying the template
Whitelist: the apps not selected in the template will be invisible to the apps applying the template.
Are you sure to delete the template?
If this is not enabled, remember to check webview in whitelist to avoid crashes of built-in browser
Copy this config to other apps
Fill in an item to be filtered

Although It is incorrect to detect specific app installation, yet not every app using root provides random packagename support. In this case, detected apps that use root (such as Fake Location and Storage Isolation) is equal to detected root itself.

At the same time, some smart apps use various loopholes to acquire your applist, so that it can draw a persona for you.

This module provides some methods to test whether you have already hidden your applist nicely. Also, it can work as an Xposed module to hide some apps or reject applist requests to protect your privacy.

#How to enable hide#\nYou can create templates in \"Manage Templates\". Then apply the templates in \"Select Effective Apps\". (You can also select extra apps for targets.) You should and ONLY should check \"System Framework\" in Xposed module scope / whitelist.
#Is template modification effective in real time#\nExcept for file interception, yes. To update file interception policy, you need to force stop and restart target apps.
Normal apps use some of API requests to acquire applist, but bad apps will use other methods (loopholes) to detect it.
